dialogues.text: It will feel strange for a few days, but should start to feel normal again soon. Alright, lookin' good. I s'pose I should write you a note for school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor writes the note. While he does so he makes chi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your Dad doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not great. I don't know. You should probably just ask him yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Elsberry drones on from the front of the class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we consider that dreams serve a metaphoric function in narrative fiction, as they do in life, what metaphoric function would you suggest the dreams here are serving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ sits in the back of the class, by the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little pebble hits TJ's desk. It bounces onto the floor looks around to find where it came from - and then anothe hits him in the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks out the window. Hesher is right outside the wind takes the cap off of a large BLACK MAGIC MARKER. He holds to his nose and takes a long slow inhale. He exhales slow long, staring hard at TJ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ looks around confused. Hesher recaps the marker, throw hard at TJ and wanders off. The marker hits TJ, then fall floor near his feet. He reaches for it. Mrs. Elsberry see

dialogues.speaker: MRS ELSBERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: TJ! What are you doing? Please pass that forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ passes the marker forward. Mrs. Elsberry sets the mark her desk.

dialogues.speaker: MRS ELSBERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You can collect this after class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She continues back to the chalkboard.

dialogues.speaker: MRS ELSBERRY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: OK, so for our protagonist, are these dreams premonitions or desires or even nightmares perhaps?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's after school. Kids are leaving campus. TJ wheels his across the school yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ rides his bike down the street. Dustin's YELLOW MUSTAN appears beside him. Dustin is boiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're fuckin' dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see that someone has drawn - in BIG BLACK MARKER - a c picture of a body, sitting on a toilet with a big erect p The picture is drawn on the side of Dustin's Mustang door his real head lines up with the drawing. It's drawn in perspective so it looks like Dustin's head is attached to naked defecating body to outsiders. The words 'SUCK MY CO have been scrawled beside the picture. Dustin swerves the toward TJ, narrowly missing him. TJ cuts into a large sup market parking lot, attempting to get away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dustin accelerates ahead of TJ and screeches to a halt in of him, cutting him off, almost hitting him. TJ stumbles falls off his bike. His bike lands on top of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dustin jumps out of his car and starts beating TJ in the of parking lot traffic. TJ struggles just to protect hims cowering on the ground and covering his head. Dustin trie wrestle TJ free of the bike so as to get a clearer shot a He drags TJ by his T-shirt, ripping it off in the process

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then a WOMAN'S VOICE -

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dustin ignores the voice. He continues beating TJ.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey! Leave him alone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dustin ignores again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! I said stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dustin ignores one last time - a beat passes, then the wo NICOLE (mid-20s), appears behind Dustin and jumps onto hi bear hugging his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave him alone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dustin shakes erratically, Nicole has a tight grip on him eventually Dustin manages to throw her onto the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing lady?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole picks herself up off the ground and holds up her f like she's ready to fight. She doesn't look very tough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole stands defiantly between Dustin and TJ. Dustin loo around at the scene he's created in the street. A man ste of his car. Dustin realizes it's time to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not finished, you fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets back into his car, slams the door and speeds off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole watches him go, then helps TJ up. TJ is shirtless, scrawny, dirty and traumatized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I bleeding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so. Am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ grabs his T-shirt and pulls it back on. He picks his b off the ground and hops on. He goes to peddle, but the ch busted. His peddling goes nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole drives. TJ is in the passenger seat. TJ's bike is in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe he called me lady. Do I look like a lady to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I guess?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. I mean do I look old? Well anyway, at least I can say I've been in a fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She thinks about this for a beat. TJ is silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe he called me lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ notices an ice-cream cone sitting in a cup-holder betw seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think your ice cream's melting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries to pick it up, suddenly flustered. It drips everywhere. She doesn't know what to do with it. It's too to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, fuck it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She throws it out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, so I'm kinda like a hero now, aren't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ looks over confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well actually, I basically just didn't want to have to go home and then spend the rest of the day feeling bad about the fact that I didn't help you and then hear about you on the news being beat to death in the parking lot. So you know, really I'm just - I did it for me. I'm just selfish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm sorry, I'm sorry I'm like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ is silent, he has no idea how to respond to this girl. spots a gas station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, gas station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She quickly makes an illegal turn into oncoming traffic. honk at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoaaa... sorry, sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pull up next to a gas pump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect landing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like black or red?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, I don't know, black?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black? Really? Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, red?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole walks off. TJ watches her for a beat then his eye over the contents of her messy car. He picks up a white n from the coin tray between the seats. It reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RALPH'S - Hi my name is NICOLE, how can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ looks up and sees Nicole heading back to the car. He p name tag down as the car door opens and Nicole gets in. S hands him a stick of red licorice covered in green sugar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole and TJ are driving. They eat sour licorice. TJ's n enjoying it, but not wanting her to know this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's super sour isn't it? You don't have to eat it if you don't like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's really sour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, that's the point. I used to hate this crazy sour stuff, I don't know what happened. I just recently acquired a taste for it. I don't even really know what's in it, but I pretty much eat it all the time. And I'm sure it's making me fat. I just don't want to end up like those fat old ladies you sometimes see, you know, the really fat ones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ doesn't know what to make of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know why I'm telling you this. Anyway, I was secretly hoping that you loved these -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding up the licorice, then taking a bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you could eat 'em for me. But now I can see you don't like em' and I'm kinda glad cuz it means more for me. I guess I'm sort of a hypocrite in a way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles at that. TJ attempts to smile back, but he's s confused he ends up making a strange face. He awkwardly l away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole's car pulls up. TJ gets out and notices a dirty bl creeping slowly around the corner toward them. This makes very nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, thanks for the ride. I really appreciate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hurries to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want your bike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ notices his bike still in Nicole's back seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ rushes back. He drags it out of her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wheels it back towards the house. TJ goes around the s the house to the back door. He knocks on the back door. G appears at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, TJ. What you doing around the back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandma lets TJ in. TJ is nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just, I dunno. I was just dumping my bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ heads for the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Dad's gone to the supermarket, honey. Everything OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, yeah, OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But TJ isn't listening. He can't stop thinking about that van. He exits the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ walks the hall carefully to the front door. He squints through the peephole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black van is parked directly in front of the house. T see properly through the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns, to get a better look through the TV room window 25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ turns to the living room. There is Hesher standing in middle of the room with a dirty duffel bag over his shoul

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ is petrified. They stand looking at each other for a l moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the laundry room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad'll be home soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the laundry room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got two seconds to tell me where the laundry room is before I tear your fuckin' head off and skull fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ points to a door off the lounge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's through there. But why? You can't - my dad's gonna be home soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher stares at him for a second, then heads for the doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher empties his sack into the washing machine. TJ step the room, wary. Hesher ignores him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher strips off his T-shirt and jeans and add them to t load. He's now standing in the laundry room wearing under only. TJ sees bad burn scars running down Hesher's thighs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher pours laundry detergent liberally into the machine

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? You can't -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher turns on a dime and grabs TJ by his throat and pin against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear to god. I'll cut your face off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He closes the lid. He wrenches the dial around and clicks 'start'. The machine begins a loud cycle. Hesher exits. T follows awkwardly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher sits in the middle of the couch and lights a cigar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't smoke in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher drags deep and blows the smoke out in a long whist straight into the air above him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher flicks his cigarette, ashing on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? You can't smoke in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher looks at him and ashes on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you please put it out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I put it out in your mouth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! Wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ enters the kitchen. Grandma is crumbing chicken fillet the counter. She's listening to loud talk radio. TJ goes straight for the cupboards and looks through them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandma turns, eyebrows raised. She turns the radio down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna make a cake. Do you remember my cherry cake story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ gets down on his knees and digs his way through the cu while Grandma rambles, continuing her chicken crumbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to make a cherry cake all the time and it always came out just wonderful. One time I invited my doctor and his wife and I wanted to make an impression. I asked him to come see your dad in a play and he came and I said, 'would you like to come back to the house?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ emerges from the cupboard with a bowl. He turns toward sink and begins to fill it with water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he said, or his wife said, 'yes they'd like to come back.' So earlier that day I made a cherry cake and I used a - I didn't know it till afterwards, I used a new product - instead of Crisco, I used Fluffo. They never made it again that Fluffo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandma, can I hear the rest of your story later? I'm kinda busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, of course honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ enters, carrying the bowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher is on the couch, smoking. The TV is now on. He fli channels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ stands next to Hesher. Hesher looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door opens and Dad enters, wearing old sweatpan dirty T-shirt, and carrying a plastic grocery bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops when he sees the practically naked, greasy-haire smoking on the couch (his 'bed'). It's a strange moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ, who's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a long uncomfortable silence, Hesher stands and ext his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name's Hesher. Call me Hesher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul has to rearrange the bags to shake his hand. Hesher back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's doing laundry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand looking at each other. TJ is just plain stress

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is he smoking in the house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher continues flipping channels. He's not finding anyt wants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you tell him he can't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come you only have four channels?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher gets up off the couch and exits the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher enters the kitchen. Grandma is still crumbing chic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts going through drawers right next to her. He doe acknowledge her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandma notices him, but not seemingly his cigarette, his of undress or his complete stranger-ness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, old lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His cigarette is done. He flicks it into the sink. It siz out. He opens another drawer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad enters with his grocery bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you with something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher shuts the drawer. He's holding a fork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope, I'm good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He exits the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher strides across the back lawn in his underwear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ and Dad step out the door and watch him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher reaches a telephone pole and climbs it nimbly like monkey. At the top, he fiddles around with the fork, bang wrenching at the cable box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drops the fork to the ground and begins his descent. O couple of feet from the ground, he loses his grip and fal crashing down into a thick bush at the base of the pole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ and Dad stand staring frozen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher lifts himself up out of the bushes, brushes himsel and heads back to the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks right past them and back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher sits back down on the couch and begins to flip thr the newly acquired channels. He finds porn and drops the down beside him. He sits back and watches girl-on-girl ac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ and Dad stand just inside the TV room, stunned, watchi newly acquired porn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then a LOUD BUZZ marking the end of the wash's cycle soun the laundry room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher gets up off the couch and heads for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stunned and silent (bar the porn noise) moment later, T follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad picks up the remote and switches the TV off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher loads his wet laundry into the dryer. TJ's nervous

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, ah, what are you doing now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher slams the dryer door shut and wrenches the dial ar The dryer starts up loud. Hesher pretends he can't hear T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and looks into the garage which is right off the laundry room. He points inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This your room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (huh?) That's the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher walks into the garage with his bag and slams the d leaving TJ standing in the laundry room with the noisy dr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ sits at the dinner table with Dad and Grandma. From th garage we hear a muffled bass guitar playing loud and hea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does your friend want to eat some dinner dear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he doing in the garage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I said he could practice his guitar in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's great honey, it's nice having a bit of music in the house again. Is he a new friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sort of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know your grandfather played the harmonica for many years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ doesn't respond. He eats. Dad looks on perplexed, yet disconnected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ is dressed for school, wet hair. He brushes his teeth. hear the sound of cartoons in the background. TJ stops br and listens a second. He hasn't heard cartoons at this ho long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ enters the TV room. Dad is lying on the couch. Hesher an armchair eating a bowl of cereal and watching cartoons

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ stands for a beat and watches them. This is strange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ enters the kitchen. Grandma pulls a bottle of orange j out of the fridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher, would you like a glass of orange juice.

dialogues.speaker: HESHER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Ah, yeah. Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning, TJ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Grandma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ goes to the counter. He pours cereal into a bowl. He g the milk carton. He pours it into the bowl, but the carto empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sorry, honey. We're out of milk. I can cook you up some eggs if you like, dear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thanks. I don't have time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ leans back and looks into the TV room at Hesher enjoyi milky cereal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to come for a walk with me today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't, Grandma. I gotta go to school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I mean later. This afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ grabs his backpack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Can you ask me when I get home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lunch yard is busy. The crowd clears a moment and we sitting on a bench in the shade, alone and depressed, hid away from the other kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drinks from a can of soda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ rides his bike into the car lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ stands staring at the crashed red Volvo (from the open scene) that is parked on the lot. He takes a few deep bre 33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ walks up to an open office door and knocks. Inside is TOWERS. He looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah? What about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ enters and sits opposite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to get the car back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I figured that. You made it pretty clear the last time you were here, and I thought I made it pretty clear that I couldn't give it to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I need to do to get it back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car's not for sale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to get it back, though. How much do you want for it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry takes a breath. He doesn't want to be having this conversation. He counts the obstacles out on his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. We're talking at least eighteen hundred dollars, not including taxes, registration, ADM, or dealer's fees. On top of that, you'd need a driver's license. I'm guessing you don't have one of those. You'd need valid car insurance. I'm guessing you don't have that either. But even if you did have these things, I still couldn't sell it to you because the car's not street legal. There's a million reasons why I can't sell it to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a second it seems Larry feels sympathetic toward TJ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look kid, I appreciate your enthusiasm, I really do, but I don't know what to tell you. You can't have the car. End of story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: What have I done to deserve this chain reaction of shit all the time? Sometimes I wonder if I were to die right now, if anyone would care, or even notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lets out a small disbelieving laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's nice of you to say, but I doubt it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would. If you died right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ thinks a moment. It's a sweet and sour moment. He want cheer Nicole up, but he's remembering his Mom at the same

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mainly because I'd be sitting in a car with a dead lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole sniffs, smiling through her tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't call me lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles warmly at TJ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts the key in the ignition and turns it. Nothing. N takes a breath - not wanting to get upset again. She turn and smiles sadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna steer or push?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ enters the house, he leaves his wet shoes and socks at door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He enters the kitchen. Hesher sits at the table, waiting dinner. Grandma is serving food onto plates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ sits. Hesher is smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi TJ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Grandma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So did you fuck her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! No?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad enters tying the drawstring on his track pants. He lo messy as ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where were you today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Counselling - 3:30, I'm there by myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sorry. I forgot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's real nice. This thing is for you just as much as it is for me. I waited outside school for 45 minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I told you I don't want to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should let me know before you don't show up next time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did. I told you I didn't want to go. I told you a hundred times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I did. You're just not listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you didn't. What you told me was that you didn't want to go. You didn't tell me that you were just not going to show up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What difference does it make?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For me a big difference. It means, I'm sitting on a fucking beanbag in a room full of losers by myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandma sets more food on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys please, I'm not feeling well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandma heads back to the kitchen to grab more food. Ther silence at the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you pass me my pills?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher slides dad's pill bottle over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher puts his finger into the mashed potatoes and wiggl around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (discreetly, to TJ) Did you finger her twat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher licks the potatoes off his finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Language. I don't wanna hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear what he just said?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care. If I hear it again, you're going to your room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My room!? You gonna start punishing me now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I need to. If it's not the language, then it's your lack of responsibility... or I'm having to escort you down to the police station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, dad. I'm really sorry you had your ass dragged off the couch. I'm sorry you had to put some fucking underpants on for the first time in months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ sits and fumes, nostrils flaring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, what, soon as I'm right, that's enough?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ! I don't want to hear one more word from you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Fuck this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ sweeps his plate off the table. It goes crashing onto kitchen floor, food everywhere. Grandma walks back into t room, looking worried. Hesher seems riveted, like he's wa the tennis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then Dad sweeps his plate off the table. Crash, food, He glares back at TJ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That make you feel better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ wrenches his chair back and storms off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad sits a moment. With TJ gone, his reproach turns to sh Grandma and Hesher make eye contact with each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad gets up and leaves the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher shovels some more food into his mouth. Grandma loo concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I miss something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really. Paul came in and said some dumb shit which TJ got angry about and so TJ smashed his plate and then Paul smashed his plate too but I got a feeling he smashed his one cuz he couldn't actually think of anything to say cuz he kinda knew TJ had a point and so now he feels bad about it and so he's gone somewhere. (takes another mouthful) I don't know where.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandma contemplates this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those boys have been through a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This makes Grandma very sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I wonder if they're ever gonna smile again

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears well in Grandma's eyes. Grandma is quietly crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wish there was something more I could do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher doesn't know what to say. He pours applesauce on h food. Grandma looks around the kitchen at the mess. She s her head, takes a deep breath and starts cleaning up. She up bits of broken plate and takes them to the sink. Heshe watches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is delicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, dear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher holds up a piece of bacon covered in applesauce an off the sauce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's green and slimy and smells like bacon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, dear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's green and slimy and smells like bacon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A worm? I don't know. I'm going to lie down. I'm not feeling well. I'm very nauseated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandma exits. Hesher finishes the last few bites of his He notices Dad's pill bottle. He reaches for them. He uns the lid and empties a few into his hand. He swallows the

dialogues.text: Grandma lies in bed on top of her covers. Hesher enters t doorway and knocks lightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you figure it out yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Figure what out, dear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's green and slimy and smells like bacon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not yet dear. Can you do me a favor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you please hand me that red tin on the cabinet dear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher enters the room, grabs the tin from on top of the and hands it to Grandma on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kermit the frog's finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think about it... Miss Piggy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandma opens her red tin and takes out what looks like a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woah, what's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm feeling very nauseated. They're medical cigarettes that help me with the nausea. Will you light a match for me, dear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on a second. Can I see that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher sniffs the "cigarette".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher sets the "cigarette" down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher dashes out of Grandma's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a few moments, he comes back and sits on the edge o bed. He is holding a glass BONG. The bong has so much res caked onto the sides, it looks as though a thousand pound marijuana have been smoked through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher takes one of Grandma's medical joints and breaks i half and loads the bowl of the pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a bong. The water filters the smoke. It's probably the most healthy way to smoke weed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher lights up and takes a HUGE hit from the bong. He e his technique to Grandma while holding the smoke in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, so basically cover the hole here with your thumb then suck on the top and once the chamber fills with smoke, take your finger off the hole and suck in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher takes a quick sip of air sucking the smoke deeper his lungs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then try and hold the smoke in for as long as possible, OK bro?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Umm, OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandma takes the bong and has a hit. It's a bit clunky, manages to make it work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, lift your finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher helps her. The smoke shoots into her lungs. Grandm begins to cough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, wow... That was a big one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that was good. Hit it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandma has another hit. It goes well. She blows out the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher takes the bong off her and has another HUGE one fo himself. He passes the bong back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'm OK, dear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher takes the last hit. He dusts off the bowl and sets water pipe down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit for a moment and let the drug sink in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, how old are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who wants to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. You seem a little older than TJ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, stop it. Aren't you a little old to be hanging around TJ all the time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm his grandmother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess you have a point... OK, well I used to have a mouse. No, wait... hang on a minute. I used to have a snake. And do you know what snakes eat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, there's no limit to the food items that you can even think of that a snake might eat. Whatever is available in abundance would become the prey for the snakes. Depending on their growth, their diet -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher cuts her off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, OK, OK well, actually they eat mice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do eat mice. A lot of times snakes eat other snakes because they're the right shape -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, OK, well anyway... I used to have a snake and I fed it mice. But one time I fed this little fuckin' mouse to my snake and that mouse was tough. I dropped that mouse in the snake's tank and the snake wouldn't go near him, and any time he tried that mouse would just smack him with his little, you know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher looks at his hand, not knowing what mouse hands ar called.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With his little mouse hand. So instead of eating the mouse the snake just curled up crying in the corner and the mouse ruled that fuckin' cage. And this went on for weeks, the snake wouldn't go near him. That tiny mouse used to sit in a little miniature lawn chair scratching his balls and shelling peanuts and this snake was just too scared to go near it. And cuz the snake was scared of that mouse I had to feed him other mice, but every time I dropped another mouse in the tank, it'd hide behind the brave mouse. And so eventually the snake starved to death. I had a cage full of mice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandma is stoned and sleepy and fading out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So is TJ the mouse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then, what am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're an old lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm a grandmother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you are. And you know what grandmother? I'm gonna go on a walk with you in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's nice. Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going anywhere. I'm going with you. Around the block, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, OK, well have a nice time. I'll see you when you get back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm going with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohh, OK, caauuse iii...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandma has fallen asleep, but mumbles like she is contin the conversation. Hesher smiles to himself, turns off her and exits the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher enters. He stands over what's left of the mess on kitchen floor. He lights up a cigarette off the stove's f and takes a long, slow drag, as he crouches down and star picking up pieces of broken plate from the pile.

dialogues.text: Dad is asleep on the couch. A single shaft of bright sunl lands on his face, causing him to stir.

dialogues.text: TJ nimbly reaches down to the table, covered with dirty d and pill bottles, and quietly picks up his dad's wallet. removes an ATM card and places the wallet back where it w exits.

dialogues.text: TJ walks through the showroom to Larry's office. Larry is phone. TJ stands and waits. Larry watches him. The kid is going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, why don't you just have him send them over... Sure... Scott, can you hold on a minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on the phone here. Can you see that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on the phone. Wait outside. I'll be with you in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ takes a seat outside the office. Larry closes the door Dustin Howard appears.

dialogues.text: The fuck are you doing here?

dialogues.text: I came to talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's none of your business.

dialogues.text: What do you wanna talk to him about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ ignores him. Dustin taps TJ's leg with his foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want to talk about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just leave me alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry's door opens. Larry emerges from his office. TJ sta

dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.text: I got the money.

dialogues.text: What money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The money for the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What money for the car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said if I got eighteen hundred dollars I could have the car back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, 'even if you had eighteen hundred dollars, I still couldn't sell it to you.' Even if you had five million dollars, I couldn't sell it to you. It's not even here any more anyway, so that's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ flinches. He wasn't expecting this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What do you mean-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kid. Leave me alone. I feel like I've had this conversation with you too many times already, but I can tell you we won't be having it again because the car's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all over. It's gone. It's not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's it gone?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kid. It's over. Good bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry steps back into his office and shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's it gone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dustin smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what makes you think I'm gonna tell you?

dialogues.text: TJ stares, angry. An awkward moment passes. He storms awa dragging a water cooler down as he leaves. It crashes ont ground. Water spills everywhere.

dialogues.text: TJ angrily winds his way toward the back of the lot. He s the spot where his mom's car once was - now just an empty

dialogues.text: Dad sits on the couch, his head in his hands. He looks up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He punches a hold in the wall. He paces angrily back &amp Dad, holding back tears, gets up off the coach and hugs T

dialogues.text: Teej. Grandma, she's not.. she's not waking up.

dialogues.text: Short fast heavy breathing sets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He disappears into the room for a second then emerges aga tears, his hands on his face. He heads back to the living

dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, she just, she just didn't wake up.

dialogues.text: Hesher breaks the silence. He kicks the table over as he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaves through the front door, leaving it open behind

dialogues.text: He enters and leans down to Grandma and tries to lift her the bed. She is heavy for him, he struggles.

dialogues.text: Hi, it's Nicole. I'm not in right now, but leave a message and I'll call you back.

dialogues.text: Beep.

dialogues.text: Ah, hi. It's TJ here. I, ah, I'm sorry to bug you, but um, I don't know, I guess I wanted to talk to you right now. I don't know. I have a present for you too, so maybe I'll just come drop it off or something, or ah, yeah... Um, OK. Bye.

dialogues.text: TJ walks out the front door. Dad is quietly sitting on th steps wearing a T-shirt in the light rain. TJ goes to his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Getting some fresh air, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.text: TJ rides his bike. He rounds a corner onto Nicole's stree

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knocks on the door. No answer. The music is really lou

dialogues.text: He knocks again. No answer. He tries the door handle. It
