dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ walks over to a door. It's an inch ajar. He pushes it gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't see what he sees, but TJ stands deathly still, e wide, white as a ghost. We hear Nicole giggle. Then -

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh shit. TJ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ storms away, heading for the front door. He pulls a la smashing to the ground on his way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ charges down the stairs. He grabs his bike and heads o the street. Light rain falls. We see Hesher appear behind barefoot and topless, buttoning his jeans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ notices Hesher's van parked out the front, he drops hi and grabs a rusty pipe from a pile of garbage on the side and heads straight toward the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey... wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ takes a hard swing into the van, smashing the tail lig Nicole runs out into the street, concerned, wearing an ov sweatshirt and underpants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! The fuck are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ ignores him and takes another swing at the van. Hesher approaches TJ. TJ takes a swing at him with the pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher steps back. Nicole gasps, her hand to her mouth. S doesn't know what to say or do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you. Fuck you fuck you fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop hitting my van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're a fucking whore. I hope you die. And when you do, no one's gonna fuckin' notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cuz you're a fat fucking prostitute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher steps toward TJ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, chill out for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ swings the pipe at Hesher again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the fuck away from me! I'll smash you in the face, I swear to God. Back the fuck up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ swings again. He's so angry, he's practically foaming mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never want to see you or your ugly fucking face again. That goes for both of you fucking assholes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ throws the pipe at Hesher. It hits the road with a lou clang. TJ grabs his bike and rides away furiously. Hesher Nicole watch TJ ride away. It begins to rain hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ glides his bike down a long hill in the pouring rain, tears. 87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ rides up the front porch. A funeral home truck is park the front - HAPPY EVER AFTER is written on the side. TJ d his bike and enters the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad sits at the dining room table with a FUNERAL DIRECTOR tall, lanky man. He talks in a drawn, soft monotone. Dad appear to be at all in the mood for this conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After the service we have complimentary lemonade in our wake room, but should you wish to upgrade to soda and sandwiches we can arrange that. People typically like to have a light bite after the service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door slams. TJ storms past the dining room tabl funeral director pauses and watches him pass. The sound o bedroom door slamming shakes the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ is angrily pacing back and forth. A gentle knock revea at his door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ refuses to look at his dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you just leave me alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad doesn't know what to say beyond this. He feels as los does. He leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ paces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He enters the garage violently. TJ sweeps Hesher's belong off the work bench in the garage. He kicks Hesher's sleep and pillow. A weathered bass guitar leans against a littl amplifier. TJ kicks the guitar, snapping it in two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of breath, he stands in the mess he has created. Some catches his eye. He contemplates this for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on: GARDEN SHEARS. TJ pockets them and exits the ga

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ heads straight toward the front door of the house. He

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's raining hard. TJ storms out, just as Hesher is makin way up the path, his van parked on the street behind him. reaches out his arm to slow TJ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ pushes Hesher's arm out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your fucking hands away from me! I told you, I never want to see you again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher, at a loss, watches TJ grab a brick from the muddy and throw it through the passenger side window of his van

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher charges TJ. He throws him into the muddy garden an kneels over him holding him by the collar of his hooded sweatshirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fuckin' told you, leave my van out of this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher lifts TJ up and slams him back down on the ground, knocking the wind out of him. TJ struggles to get away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go of me! Fuckin' let go of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad runs out the front door and pulls Hesher off TJ by th of his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What in God's name -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher shakes free from Dad's grip and punches him square nose. Dad goes down hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fuckin' touch m-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without hesitation, TJ jumps on Hesher's back, bear huggi face. They struggle for a beat, until Hesher manages to t off. He lands on the wet grass like a ragdoll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you both! Motherfuckers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher stands breathing hard, dripping wet from the rain, clenched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back to his van, gets in, slams the door and pee away. TJ picks himself up out of the mud, grabs his bike rides off in the opposite direction. Dad stands holding h bloody nose. He watches Hesher, he watches TJ. He is left confused and bleeding in the pouring rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's raining cats and dogs. TJ stands outside Dustin's ho soaking wet with his hoodie pulled over his head, the gar shears in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks around the side of the house and looks in the wi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From TJ's POV outside, we see Dustin in the kitchen prepa sandwich, one eye on the TV. He takes the sandwich to the in front of the TV and lies down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ walks around the back of the house. He tries the handl the back door. It's locked. TJ sees the dog door. He clim through the flap, trying to be as quiet as possible. The loud inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ treads softly through the kitchen, soaking wet, shears poised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks through to the living area. He steps behind the out of Dustin's line of sight. Dustin's bare feet hang of end of the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ ducks down. He opens the shears and carefully brings t down over Dustin's big toe. He squeezes them shut...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dustin squeals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my fucking car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You make me ask one more time, your toe's coming off. I swear to God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gone to the wrecker's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wrecking yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ squeezes a little harder. Dustin squeals a little loud

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would I be lying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're a fucking asshole. Tell me where it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gone to the wrecker's. I swear to God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ squeezes harder. Dustin squeals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not lying. It went to the wrecking yard on Sunrise near Red Bridge, yesterday afternoon. It's there now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ thinks, holding Dustin's toe in his grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear to God, man. It's at the wrecking yard on Sunrise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're lying, I'm gonna cut off every one of your fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ doesn't quite know what to do now. He stares at Dustin looks genuinely frightened. TJ releases the shears and ba away. And the second he does so, Dustin leaps off the cou grabs TJ by the throat and slams him down on the living r floor. TJ drops the shears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You finished? Want to tell me something else while you're visiting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dustin wails into TJ. TJ cowers on the ground. Punches la

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LAWN CHAIR comes CRASHING through the front window into living room, raining glass everywhere. Dustin stops punch stunned, and looks up to see Hesher, dripping wet, step t the big nasty hole he has just made.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dustin moves to stand. Hesher pounces on him, dragging hi the ground. He grabs the shears and brings them straight Dustin's nose. In the same movement, he snaps the shears and takes the end of Dustin's nose off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dustin squeals in pain and scurries backwards, clutching face, blood leaking between his fingers. TJ stands, stunn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god, my nose!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just saved you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cut his nose off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only a bit, it's just a cut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dustin is crying now, clutching his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ goes to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just cut his nose off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ runs a rag under the tap and takes it to Dustin. Heshe stands, clutching the shears, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold this against your face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dustin moans. Hesher is still confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta stop the bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dustin holds the rag. TJ stands to face Hesher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you outta my life. I'm serious. I never want to see you again. How many times do I have say it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other a moment. Hesher looks taken abac honestly believed he was doing a good thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ leaves, through the front door. Hesher stands over a whimpering Dustin wondering what went wrong. 93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ rides his bike over a rickety red bridge. He pulls his up outside the tall wire fence of a big dirty wrecking ya D&S Auto-Wreckers. It's still raining very hard. TJ i wet. He sits on his bike, looking at mountains of wrecked inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ hops off his bike and shoves it behind a dumpster. He on the dumpster and climbs the wrecking yard's fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. D&S WRECKING YARD - MOMENTS LATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ roams the stacks, looking for his mother's car. He loo distraught. All around sit stacks of wrecked cars. A vici on a chain barks and snarls nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ stops. He sees his mom's car atop a tall stack of wrec looks at it a moment, contemplating what to do. He moves base of the stack and begins to climb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He clambers slowly up the pile in the rain. It's awkward difficult and more than a little dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally he reaches the top. He wrenches open the car door squeezes behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ sits, catching his breath. The rain clatters on the ro the car. TJ is up high enough to see the lights of the surrounding neighborhood. He sits and contemplates the la days and months of his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A doorbell rings. TJ runs to the door wearing the bottom suit. It's the pizza man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. (yells into house) Pizza's here, I need money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, clean shaven, dressed in a suit, comes to the door a pays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yells into the house) OK, pizza's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, let's do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman comes down the stairs with her hair nicely done wearing a fancy pink dress, it's TJ's MOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teej, c'mon sweetheart. We have to go. We're going to be late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the pizza?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll eat it in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She begins to do up TJ's tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, will you grab the present?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad picks up a large box off the side table, it's clearly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy crap, what is this thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three emerge from the house. TJ is wearing a suit and carrying the pizza box, Dad's carrying the heavy present, Mom's carrying a bouquet of flowers and her purse. Dad st the door of a little white car. Clearly the box is too bi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, slight problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom open the back of her red volvo which is parked right the white car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll take my car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad does a heel spins around the white car and heads towa Mom's red volvo, never losing a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure thing. 95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad's driving, eating a slice of pizza. TJ is in the back looking out the window, also eating pizza. Mom does her m in the visor mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we should keep the new one and give them our old one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a great idea. I'll be sure to let them know that our dirty old microwave is a gift from you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I'm not even sure they know who I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, they're my friends. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, I just don't understand why they get so many presents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A microwave and a bottle of scotch is hardly a lot of presents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom half-laughs and shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mouth full of pizza) Mom can you turn on the radio?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure honey. How about some oldies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oldies but goodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom turns on the oldies station. Dion And The Belmont's, Teenager In Love" plays. Dad sings along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car hits a bump. Mom smudges her lipstick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to Dad and we can see her lipstick has gone up her cheek. She smiles at Dad. They all smile at this, the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From out of nowhere, the car is T-BONED on the passenger' The impact is massive. The NOISE is deafening. Smashed gl The car spins into the oncoming traffic and is hit by a d truck. The car flips. More deafening noise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. RED VOLVO / D&S WRECKING YARD - MORNING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ wakes in the wrecked car at the wrecking yard. The lou of crunching metal continues. TJ is startled and disorien realizes the car is moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crane is lifting the car with a huge wrecking yard magn it rises off the stack, it dangles at a precarious angle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ is thrown through the car to be wedged up against the windshield. He panics. He yells. He squirms his way to th window and waves his arm wildly outside, yelling, trying the attention of the guys below. The car shifts violently slides out through the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. D&S WRECKING YARD - CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ is hanging dangerously out of the car, swinging his le screaming at the top of his lungs. His voice can barely b over the sound of machinery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A guy on the ground, MARIO, looks up and spots TJ. He frantically looks to get the crane operator's attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky! Kill it, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky sticks his head out of the crane cab, like he can't

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill it! There's someone in the car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mario points. Ricky looks up. Both men can see TJ danglin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. D&S WRECKING YARD - MOMENTS LATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the car is lowered TJ jumps the last few feet to the g Mario leads him away from the car and the crane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you doing in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This car's about to get crushed. If I didn't see you, you would be dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you thinking, man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ doesn't respond, he backs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mario watches him walk away, still disbelieving. He turns to Ricky and gives him the all clear to start her up agai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ walks to the entrance gate while behind him his mom's hoisted high in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ stops at a dirty vending machine by the gate. He pulls from his pocket and slots them in. It spits out a chocola

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moments later TJ stands with his half-eaten chocolate bar watching his Mom's car get fed into a giant crushing mach compacted into scrap. Tears well in his eyes. He feels he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ walks in the front door. Dad jumps up from the couch. a bandage on his nose and a black eye. He looks distraugh he's been up all night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where have you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where have you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I lost track of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lost track of time? It's ten in the morning!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been up all night. How is that fair to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad looks at him, breathing hard. Tears well in his eyes. starts crying, he's falling to bits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just go to your room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad knows he's being pathetic. TJ walks off down the hall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ stands in front of a mirror trying to correctly tie hi tie. He makes a sad attempt and leaves it - it looks wron

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a knock at TJ's bedroom door, but the door doesn'

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: There's someone at the front door for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole stands at the door. TJ is unimpressed with seeing stands in the doorway looking silly with his tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher's not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to tell you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know if I should come here or not, but I couldn't stop thinking about it. I thought maybe if I came you'd still just be really angry at me and hate me, but then I thought if I didn't you'd think I didn't care and you'd hate me anyway, so I figured I might as well come, just in case, so here I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well what do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to apologize. I feel bad about what happened. I didn't take your feelings into consideration -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, whatever. It doesn't really matter. I have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes it does. It does to me. I like you, TJ. We're friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ looks at her, he doesn't really want to be mad at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand if you don't want to be my friend. I didn't mean to hurt your feelings. Sometimes I just... I don't know. I just wanted to come around and say all that, but maybe you still hate me and so it doesn't matter, but I just came round to say that, but I've said it now, so I should just go. So, OK, bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole walks off. She gets half way across the lawn befor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I broke your lamp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm sorry I called you a fat prostitute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not fat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole smiles at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm a prostitute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno. Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They smile at one another. She crosses the lawn back towa She fixes his tie. She smiles again and then she leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad and TJ sit in the front seat. They are still angry an speaking to each other. It is an unpleasant and uncomfort ride. They both wear a suit and tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad and TJ drive into the funeral home parking lot in Gra car. A few people are milling around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad and TJ enter the funeral home foyer. They look like t don't know where they're supposed to go. They are greeted funeral director from earlier. He talks in a soft monoton whisper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Mr. Forney, may I have a word?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes Dad aside.

dialogues.speaker: FUNERAL DIRECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I hate to have to do this here, but there's a couple of things I need to discuss with you quickly, if that's OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that we discussed your preferences for some aspects of today's service, including your choice of the cedar casket which the insurance company had covered. Unfortunately we were out of those and instead we've chosen a mahogany casket. Now there is an extra charge for the mahogany which I need to clear with you before we proceed. Is that

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad looks confused. He doesn't know how he's supposed to respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, great, thank you. If you could just sign here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The director hands Dad a fancy pen and holds out a dense form for him to sign.

dialogues.speaker: FUNERAL DIRECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just at the bottom there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad's pen hovers. He doesn't know where he's signing.

dialogues.speaker: FUNERAL DIRECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just here, Mr. Forney, just under that... yes, that's great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad signs and hands the pen back.

dialogues.speaker: FUNERAL DIRECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now, just one other thing - we have another service following yours today, we hate to do this, but we're going to have to try to get through yours as quickly as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The funeral director's cell phone vibrates loudly on his He ignores it. Dad can't.

dialogues.speaker: FUNERAL DIRECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don't want you to feel rushed, but we are really under the pump today and I just thought I should give you the heads up. Now, I notice, just looking at your order of service... (beat, thinking) Ah, look, let's play it by ear. We should be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad looks at the funeral director, not quite sure he's he him right. The funeral director's phone continues to vibr

dialogues.speaker: FUNERAL DIRECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: OK. Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The funeral director walks away and answers his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The funeral director stands at the front of the room. He play on the in-house stereo - generic classical musak. TJ Dad take seats next to each other, but they might as well hundred miles apart. About ten other people sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The funeral director hits stop. He stands and approaches microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are gathered here today to mourn the loss and commemorate the life of Madeleine Frances Forney. (to arriving late comers) Ah, if you could please take your seats as quickly as possible that'd be great. Thank you. (he waits a beat) Madeleine was a beloved wife, mother, grandmother and friend. And now Mrs Agnes Rosowski, a dear friend and neighbor, will say a few quick words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS AGNES ROSOWSKI hobbles her way to the microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did not know Madeleine long enough, but from the moment I moved into the neighborhood so many years ago, she treated me as though I was part of the family.

dialogues.speaker: MRS ROSOWSKI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Madeleine always had open arms and welcomed friends as kindly as her own. She had such a kind wonderful heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Agnes speaks, TJ and Dad notice the funeral directo to the side, whispering business to two of his employees. makes every attempt to be subtle and discreet about it, b is clearly struggling with today's workload.

dialogues.speaker: MRS ROSOWSKI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We shared so many wonderful walks and enjoyed each other's company very much. I will miss our walks. I will miss our talks and most of all, I will miss Madeleine. I will always remember what she told me, life is like walking in the rain, you can either hide and take shelter or you can just get wet. She was dear to me and she will always have a place in my heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agnes places her hand on Grandma's coffin and stands for silent beat.

dialogues.speaker: MRS ROSOWSKI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I love you, Madeleine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another drawn out moment of silence. The funeral director this opportunity to step to the microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, thank you, Agnes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agnes steps towards her seat. When she sees TJ she stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ, I think you should say something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The funeral director pauses awkward. Everyone looks at TJ

dialogues.speaker: MRS ROSOWSKI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go on, TJ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ gets up reluctantly. He doesn't know what to say. He s at the microphone and struggles for a long beat, but noth comes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ makes his way off the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sound of slow clapping from the back. It's Hesher. His ha looks extra greasy, he's wearing a dirty white Budweiser and he's holding a tall can of beer under his arm which s as he claps. He is VERY drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The funeral director tries to wrap it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, so at this point we should conclude today's service with a moment's silence, after which lemonade will be served in the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I'd like to add to TJ's speech. I think I know where he was going with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher stands and makes his way to the front. The funeral director tries politely to protest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad stands up in the aisle and tries to stop Hesher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up on the stage, funeral home employees begin wheeling Gr coffin away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher pushes past Dad and stops the coffin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Get your fuckin' hands off that box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The funeral director walks up to Hesher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, sir we really need to-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher turns and stands at the microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The funeral director looks over to Dad, not sure what to lightly puts his hand on Hesher's arm to guide him off st

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, sir-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher pushes the funeral director's arm away hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You touch me again, I'll rip your fucking head off and skull fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The funeral director backs off, scared and unsure of what

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, OK. Listen. I know you guys don't want me here and I don't want to fucking be here, but I'm not here for me, I'm fuckin' here for her-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher gestures to Grandma's coffin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - and I'm not fuckin' here to say goodbye or have my farewell or whatever the fuck you assholes call it - this is not how I want to say goodbye to someone I like - in this shit-hole with these-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher points to the funeral director.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - fuckin' assholes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ's dad stands and interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, this is enough-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well why don't you shut up for a second and listen cause I'm going to say what I want to say and then you'll never see me again. Alright?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a beat of silence. No one knows what to say or d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here cause she's been trying to tell you guys something, but you don't want to listen... so I'm gonna fuckin' break it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher takes a long pull from his beer can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I pulled the gas tank from an old Chevy and I wanted to fuckin' blow it up, so I did. I didn't think about the millions of bits of metal that were gonna fly in every direction. I almost killed myself. I woke up in a hospital. I couldn't remember what happened and then this doctor at the end of my bed said 'son', and I said, 'don't call me son you fuckin' cunt', then he said, 'you blew off your nut'. Some shrapnel had penetrated my left scrotal sack and ripped the furry sucker right off. My left fucking nut was gone, just like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher makes a magic disappearing arm gesture, spilling a beer on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went crazy. I assaulted a nurse, a doctor or two, I can't remember. I got arrested. I got sent to juvie. But all I could think about day and night was my missing fuckin' nut. I couldn't eat or sleep, I just wanted my fucking nut back. I had to get out of there and find it, so I busted out of juvie and went lookin' for it. I looked for days, but didn't find shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tiny crowd listens, half offended, half intrigued.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then one night I was taking a shit and I was just staring down at my balls, looking at my flabby piece of sack where my left nut used to be and then I noticed my right nut, for like the first time. My right nut was just sitting there, totally happy, just hanging out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All this time I'd been driving myself crazy thinking about my missing nut and not thinking about the nut I still had all along. And I realized, I've still got a nut. I've still got one good nut. God or the Devil or whoever left me with one good nut. At least I didn't lose both my nuts. I've still got one good nut and it works, and my dick works too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher looks up at TJ and Dad, sad and imploring, he's ma point. They look back at him stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lost your mom. You lost your wife. I lost a nut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher takes the last swig of his Budweiser. He sways, dr This soaks in with the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher throws the can down. He goes to stomp on it. He mi and stumbles, crashing into the microphone podium, knocki over and falling in a heap with it. He starts puking on t stage. A couple of old ladies are horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The funeral director motions to his assistants that now i time to move the coffin out. Hesitantly, they obey. Heshe over from the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave her alone. We're not finished yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unfortunately sir, we need to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue to push the coffin away. Hesher lifts himse and wipes the vomit from his face and steps toward the co The funeral workers back away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told Grandma I was going on a walk with her and I'm gonna do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Determined, Hesher leans down and unlocks the wheels of t coffin stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad stands, not exactly sure what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With purpose Hesher pushes the coffin down the stage ramp down the center aisle of the room, toward the exit. He tu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You promised Grandma you'd go on a walk with her. This is your last chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher seems overcome with emotion, he continues pushing coffin toward the exit and out through the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ and Dad watch him, unsure. After a moment, They follow the door. They stand at the doors watching Hesher push th coffin out into the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ is overcome with emotion, his eyes well with tears. He across the lot and catches up with Hesher, joining him on walk. Dad watches for a beat, his eyes well up too, then the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All three are now walking together through the funeral ho parking lot with Grandma's coffin. They don't speak. It's release. Other mourners watch from the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher wheels Grandma's coffin across the parking lot wit and Dad beside him. They seem solemn and strangely dignif a dishevelled way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher leads them out of the parking lot and into the str Traffic passes around them. Some cars come to a complete

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher gets the coffin up onto the sidewalk on the other the street and the three continue their silent walk with Grandma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In slow motion the three walk. Dad puts his arm around TJ shoulders, TJ puts his arm around Dad's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then a cop car cruises beside them slow. The cops ins watch them. Dad looks over. One of the cops smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop car pulls up outside the house. The back door ope Hesher falls out onto the sidewalk, still very drunk. Dad out and steps over Hesher helping him to his feet. A cop to them from the open window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll get him to bed now, won't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher squirms and slurs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your hands off me, pig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop gives them a casual wave as their car pulls away. Dad help Hesher across the lawn to the front door. We hol the house for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on scissors to beard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad stands over the sink cutting away at his beard. Golde sunlight pours in through the windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment later he lathers his face up with shaving cream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a gentle knock at the door. TJ wakes and makes a stretch. His hair's a mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad enters, he's clean-shaven now. He looks like a new ma

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning, Teej.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Look at you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. It feels weird. I can feel air on my face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hardly recognize you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think Hesher's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gone where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. But I think you should come take a look at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The garage door is open. The garage is flooded with dayli no sign of Hesher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ and Dad walks across the garage to the open door. At t garage's entrance they stop. Their eyes register somethin seriously unusual outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Master of Puppets' by Metallica punches in. LOUD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A giant red cube of Volvo scrap metal has been placed in center of the driveway like a huge piece of abstract art. stand and stare at it, almost in awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then from the across the street, we see the object in the driveway and TJ and Dad on the porch looking at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We also see the words 'HESHER WAS HERE!' spray painted on front of the house in big letters, as yet unseen by TJ an Dad puts his arm around TJ's shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the beat we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher ripping on the guitar; Hesher blowing something up Hesher cupping a fart and putting it in TJ's face; Hesher pantsing Dad; Hesher metal saluting Grandma and Grandma s him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesher behind the wheel of his van, smoking a cigarette a making a direct line for the setting sun.

dialogues.text: A mouse sits an in a tiny armchair like a human, shelling peanut. He throws the shell over his shoulder watching th setting sun.
